methods.name: create

args.name: version
args.desc: The version of the abstracted account application

args.name: controlledAddress
args.desc: The address of the abstracted account. If zeroAddress, then the address of the contract account will be used

args.name: admin
args.desc: The address of the admin for this application

args.name: domain
args.desc: The domain associated with the admin account

args.name: escrowFactory
args.desc: The app ID of the escrow factory to use for creating escrows

args.name: revocationApp
args.desc: The app ID of the revocation app associated with this abstracted account

args.name: nickname
args.desc: A user-friendly name for this abstracted account

args.name: referrer
args.desc: The address that referred the creation of this wallet

methods.desc:
Create an abstracted account application.
This is not part of ARC58 and implementation specific.

methods.name: register

args.name: escrow
args.desc: The name of the escrow to register, or empty string for the main account

methods.desc:
Register the abstracted account with the escrow factory.
This allows apps to correlate the account with the app without needing
it to be explicitly provided.

args.name: version
args.desc: the version of the wallet

methods.name: setDomain

args.name: domain
args.desc: The domain to associate with the admin account

methods.desc: Set the domain associated with the admin account

methods.name: setRevocationApp

args.name: app
args.desc: The app ID of the new revocation app

methods.desc: Changes the revocation app associated with the contract

methods.name: setNickname

args.name: nickname
args.desc: the new nickname of the wallet

methods.desc: Changes the nickname of the wallet

methods.name: setAvatar

args.name: avatar
args.desc: the new avatar of the wallet

methods.desc: Changes the avatar of the wallet

methods.name: setBanner

args.name: banner
args.desc: the new banner of the wallet

methods.desc: Changes the banner of the wallet

methods.name: setBio

args.name: bio
args.desc: the new bio of the wallet

methods.desc: Changes the bio of the wallet

methods.name: arc58_changeAdmin

args.name: newAdmin
args.desc: The new admin

methods.desc: Attempt to change the admin for this app. Some implementations MAY not support this.

methods.name: arc58_pluginChangeAdmin

args.name: newAdmin
args.desc: The new admin

methods.desc: Attempt to change the admin via plugin.

methods.name: arc58_verifyAuthAddress
methods.desc: Verify the abstracted account is rekeyed to this app

methods.name: arc58_rekeyTo

args.name: address
args.desc: The address to rekey to

args.name: flash
args.desc: Whether or not this should be a flash rekey. If true, the rekey back to the app address must done in the same txn group as this call

methods.desc: Rekey the abstracted account to another address. Primarily useful for rekeying to an EOA.

methods.name: arc58_canCall

args.name: plugin
args.desc: The app ID of the plugin to check

args.name: global
args.desc: Whether to check the global (zero address) caller

args.name: address
args.desc: The address that will trigger the plugin

args.name: escrow
args.desc: The escrow associated with the plugin

args.name: method
args.desc: The method selector being called on the plugin

returns.desc: Whether the plugin can be called with these parameters

methods.desc: Check whether the plugin can be used

methods.name: arc58_rekeyToPlugin

args.name: plugin
args.desc: The app ID of the plugin to rekey to

args.name: global
args.desc: Whether the plugin is callable globally

args.name: escrow
args.desc: The escrow associated with the plugin

args.name: methodOffsets
args.desc: The indices of the methods being used in the group. If the plugin has method restrictions, these indices must match the methods used on each subsequent call to the plugin within the group

args.name: fundsRequest
args.desc: If the plugin is using an escrow, this is the list of funds to transfer to the escrow for the plugin to use during execution

methods.desc: Temporarily rekey to an approved plugin app address

methods.name: arc58_rekeyToNamedPlugin

args.name: name
args.desc: The name of the plugin to rekey to

args.name: global
args.desc: Whether the plugin is callable globally

args.name: escrow
args.desc: The escrow associated with the plugin

args.name: methodOffsets
args.desc: The indices of the methods being used in the group. If the plugin has method restrictions, these indices must match the methods used on each subsequent call to the plugin within the group

args.name: fundsRequest
args.desc: If the plugin is using an escrow, this is the list of funds to transfer to the escrow for the plugin to use during execution

methods.desc: Temporarily rekey to a named plugin app address

methods.name: arc58_addPlugin

args.name: plugin
args.desc: The app ID of the plugin to add

args.name: caller
args.desc: The address allowed to call the plugin, or the global zero address for any address

args.name: escrow
args.desc: The escrow account to use for the plugin, if any. If empty, no escrow will be used, if the named escrow does not exist, it will be created

args.name: admin
args.desc: Whether the plugin has permissions to change the admin account

args.name: delegationType
args.desc: The ownership of the delegation for last_interval updates

args.name: lastValid
args.desc: The timestamp or round when the permission expires

args.name: cooldown
args.desc: The number of seconds or rounds that must pass before the plugin can be called again

args.name: methods
args.desc: The methods that are allowed to be called for the plugin by the address

args.name: useRounds
args.desc: Whether the plugin uses rounds for cooldowns and lastValid, defaults to timestamp

args.name: useExecutionKey
args.desc: Whether the plugin requires an execution key to be used

args.name: coverFees
args.desc: Whether the plugin reimburses the caller for transaction fees

args.name: canReclaim
args.desc: Whether the plugin is allowed to reclaim funds from escrows via arc58_pluginReclaim

args.name: defaultToEscrow
args.desc: Whether to use the named escrow as the default escrow (plugin key uses empty string)

methods.desc: Add an app to the list of approved plugins

methods.name: assignDomain

args.name: caller
args.desc: The address of the passkey

args.name: domain
args.desc: The domain to assign to the passkey

methods.desc: Assign a domain to a passkey

methods.name: arc58_removePlugin

args.name: plugin
args.desc: The app ID of the plugin to remove

args.name: caller
args.desc: The address that was allowed to call the plugin

args.name: escrow
args.desc: The escrow associated with the plugin

methods.desc: Remove an app from the list of approved plugins

methods.name: arc58_addNamedPlugin

args.name: name
args.desc: The plugin name

args.name: plugin
args.desc: The app ID of the plugin to add

args.name: caller
args.desc: The address allowed to call the plugin, or the global zero address for any address

args.name: escrow
args.desc: The escrow account to use for the plugin, if any. If empty, no escrow will be used, if the named escrow does not exist, it will be created

args.name: admin
args.desc: Whether the plugin has permissions to change the admin account

args.name: delegationType
args.desc: The ownership of the delegation for last_interval updates

args.name: lastValid
args.desc: The timestamp or round when the permission expires

args.name: cooldown
args.desc: The number of seconds or rounds that must pass before the plugin can be called again

args.name: methods
args.desc: The methods that are allowed to be called for the plugin by the address

args.name: useRounds
args.desc: Whether the plugin uses rounds for cooldowns and lastValid, defaults to timestamp

args.name: useExecutionKey
args.desc: Whether the plugin requires an execution key to be used

args.name: coverFees
args.desc: Whether the plugin reimburses the caller for transaction fees

args.name: canReclaim
args.desc: Whether the plugin is allowed to reclaim funds from escrows via arc58_pluginReclaim

args.name: defaultToEscrow
args.desc: Whether to use the named escrow as the default escrow (plugin key uses empty string)

methods.desc: Add a named plugin

methods.name: arc58_removeNamedPlugin

args.name: name
args.desc: The plugin name

methods.desc: Remove a named plugin

methods.name: arc58_newEscrow

args.name: escrow
args.desc: The name of the escrow to create

methods.desc: Create a new escrow for the controlled address

methods.name: arc58_toggleEscrowLock

args.name: escrow
args.desc: The escrow to lock or unlock

methods.desc: Lock or Unlock an escrow account

methods.name: arc58_reclaim

args.name: escrow
args.desc: The escrow to reclaim funds from

args.name: reclaims
args.desc: The list of reclaims to make from the escrow

methods.desc: Transfer funds from an escrow back to the controlled address.

methods.name: arc58_pluginReclaim

args.name: plugin
args.desc: The plugin app ID

args.name: caller
args.desc: The address allowed to call the plugin

args.name: escrow
args.desc: The escrow to reclaim funds from

args.name: reclaims
args.desc: The list of reclaims to make from the escrow

methods.desc:
Transfer funds from an escrow back to the controlled address via a plugin / allowed caller.
The plugin must have canReclaim set to true. CloseOut on asset transfers is blocked when the escrow is locked.

methods.name: arc58_optInEscrow

args.name: escrow
args.desc: The escrow to opt-in to

args.name: assets
args.desc: The list of assets to opt-in to

methods.desc: Opt-in an escrow account to assets

methods.name: arc58_pluginOptInEscrow

args.name: plugin
args.desc: The plugin app ID

args.name: caller
args.desc: The address allowed to call the plugin

args.name: escrow
args.desc: The escrow to opt-in assets for

args.name: assets
args.desc: The list of assets to opt-in to

args.name: mbrPayment
args.desc: The payment txn that is used to pay for the asset opt-in

methods.desc: Opt-in an escrow account to assets via a plugin / allowed caller

methods.name: arc58_addAllowances

args.name: escrow
args.desc: The escrow to add the allowance for

args.name: allowances
args.desc: The list of allowances to add

methods.desc: Add an allowance for an escrow account

methods.name: arc58_removeAllowances

args.name: escrow
args.desc: The escrow to remove the allowance for

args.name: assets
args.desc: The list of assets to remove the allowance for

methods.desc: Remove an allowances for an escrow account

methods.name: arc58_addExecutionKey

args.name: lease
args.desc: The 32-byte lease key that uniquely identifies this execution

args.name: groups
args.desc: The list of 32-byte group IDs that are authorized under this key

args.name: firstValid
args.desc: The first round or timestamp when this key becomes valid

args.name: lastValid
args.desc: The last round or timestamp when this key expires

methods.desc: Add or extend an execution key for pre-authorized plugin usage

methods.name: arc58_removeExecutionKey

args.name: lease
args.desc: The 32-byte lease key identifying the execution to remove

methods.desc: Remove an execution key. Can be called by admin at any time, or by anyone after the key has expired.

methods.name: arc58_getAdmin
methods.desc:
Get the admin of this app. This method SHOULD always be used rather than reading directly from state
because different implementations may have different ways of determining the admin.

methods.name: arc58_getPlugins

args.name: keys
args.desc: The plugin keys to look up

returns.desc: The plugin info for each key, or empty plugin info if the key does not exist

methods.desc: Get plugin info for a list of plugin keys

methods.name: arc58_getNamedPlugins

args.name: names
args.desc: The plugin names to look up

returns.desc: The plugin info for each name, or empty plugin info if the name does not exist

methods.desc: Get plugin info for a list of named plugins

methods.name: arc58_getEscrows

args.name: escrows
args.desc: The escrow names to look up

returns.desc: The escrow info for each name, or empty escrow info if the name does not exist

methods.desc: Get escrow info for a list of escrow names

methods.name: arc58_getAllowances

args.name: escrow
args.desc: The escrow to look up allowances for

args.name: assets
args.desc: The asset IDs to look up allowances for

returns.desc: The allowance info for each asset, or empty allowance info if no allowance exists

methods.desc: Get allowance info for a list of assets on a given escrow

methods.name: arc58_getExecutions

args.name: leases
args.desc: The 32-byte lease keys to look up

returns.desc: The execution info for each lease, or empty execution info if the lease does not exist

methods.desc: Get execution key info for a list of leases

methods.name: arc58_getDomainKeys

args.name: addresses
args.desc: The addresses to look up domain keys for

returns.desc: The domain string for each address, or empty string if no domain is assigned

methods.desc: Get domain key assignments for a list of addresses

methods.name: mbr

args.name: escrow
args.desc: The escrow name to calculate MBR for

args.name: methodCount
args.desc: The number of method restrictions on the plugin

args.name: plugin
args.desc: The plugin name to calculate named plugin MBR for

args.name: groups
args.desc: The number of execution groups to calculate MBR for

returns.desc: The MBR costs for plugins, named plugins, escrows, allowances, domain keys, executions, and new escrow creation

methods.desc: Calculate the minimum balance requirements for various box operations

methods.name: balance

args.name: assets
args.desc: The asset IDs to check balances for (0 for ALGO)

returns.desc: The balance for each asset including any staked amounts

methods.desc: Get the balance of a set of assets in the account, including staked amounts

version.desc: the version of the wallet contract

akitaDAO.desc: the app id of the akita DAO

admin.desc: The admin of the abstracted account. This address can add plugins and initiate rekeys

domain.desc: The domain associated with the admin account of the abstracted account

nickname.desc: A user defined nickname for their wallet

avatar.desc: A user defined NFT to display as their avatar that the user owns

banner.desc: A user defined NFT to display as their banner that the user owns

lastUserInteraction.desc: The last time the contract was interacted with in unix time

lastChange.desc: The last time state has changed on the abstracted account (not including lastCalled for cooldowns) in unix time

spendingAddress.desc: [TEMPORARY STATE FIELD] The spending address for the currently active plugin

currentPlugin.desc: [TEMPORARY STATE FIELD] The current plugin key being used

rekeyIndex.desc: [TEMPORARY STATE FIELD] The index of the transaction that created the rekey sandwich

escrowFactory.desc: the spending account factory to use for allowances

factoryApp.desc: the application ID for the contract that deployed this wallet

revocation.desc: The app that can revoke plugins

referrer.desc: The address that created the wallet

plugins.desc: Plugins that add functionality to the controlledAddress and the account that has permission to use it.

namedPlugins.desc: Plugins that have been given a name for discoverability

escrows.desc: the escrows that this wallet has created for specific callers with allowances

allowances.desc: The Allowances for plugins installed on the smart contract with useAllowance set to true

domainKeys.desc:
Passkeys on the account and their corresponding domain names
address : domain
IMPORTANT: a passkey attached to the akita domain is a co-admin passkey
we explicitly have this feature so that the wallet can be used on multiple devices
where the admin passkey may be incompatible
we track this onchain so we can assist with 'sign-in from another device' functionality
as well as uses like DAO based domain revocation

sourceInfo.errorMessage: OnCompletion must be UpdateApplication && can only call when not creating
Only an admin can add a plugin
Only an admin can change the admin account
Only an admin can change the nickname
Only an admin can change the revocation app
Only an admin can update the application
Only an admin or revocation app can remove method restrictions
Only an admin or revocation app can remove plugins
The account does not hold the asset
This contract must be deployed from a factory
This plugin does not have admin privileges
This plugin is not in control of the account
cannot call other apps during rekey
delegation type must not be self for global plugins
escrow must be set if defaultToEscrow is true
execution key update must match first valid
execution key update must match last valid
index access is out of bounds
invalid number of bytes for bool8
invalid number of bytes for uint64
invalid number of bytes for uint8
invalid number of bytes for uint8[32]
invalid number of bytes for uint8[4]
invalid oncomplete must be no op
invalid sender must be this app id
only the creator wallet can delete a spending account
using execution key requires global plugin
